alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk; Montgomery; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:52AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Elk, southern Wilson, Montgomery and Chautauqua Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 652 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Elk City, or 11 miles northeast of Sedan, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Sedan, Howard, Dearing, Moline, Longton, Elk City, Tyro, Grenola, Fall River, Peru, Liberty, Chautauqua, Elk Falls and Havana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
